summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on March 26, 2021, to an attorney at a West Palm Beach address. It commands the production of documents related to the settlement of a civil lawsuit (Jane Doe No. 2 v. Epstein) and appearance before the grand jury on April 5, 2021, in connection with an investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and coercion statutes.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: United States Attorney / Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and accompanying letter on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the civil lawsuit 'Jane Doe No. 2 v. Epstein,' the settlement documents of which are the target of the subpoena.

connections.description: Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena as part of a grand jury investigation into matters related to Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena for documents and testimony related to the settlement of a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the federal grand jury in New York to testify regarding alleged violations of sex trafficking and coercion statutes.

locations: 2139 Palm Beach Lakes Blvd., West Palm Beach, FL 33409-6601 (Subpoena recipient's address)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY (Grand jury location)
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an ongoing federal grand jury investigation in March/April 2021 into suspected felonies under 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The specific target is documents related to the settlement of the civil case 'Jane Doe No. 2 v. Epstein, No. 08 Civ. 80119' in the Southern District of Florida.
The government requested the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the subpoena's existence to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The subpoena demonstrates continued federal investigative activity related to Jeffrey Epstein well after his 2019 death.
The recipient is an attorney ('Esq.') located in West Palm Beach, Florida, suggesting a connection to the legal proceedings in the earlier Florida civil case.
